data.question: What is the molecular formula of the compound synthesized by combining enPtCl2 with AgNO3 and NaClO4?
What are the key differences between the all-trans and all-cis forms of the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+?
data.answer: The all-trans form has a C2 molecular symmetry and does not incorporate anions in its cavity, while the all-cis form has approximately C3 symmetry and can incorporate two different anions simultaneously or a single PF6- anion.

data.question: True or False: The compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3](NO3)6 can be converted into its thermodynamic product [enPt(bpz-N1,N1')]2+ upon prolonged heating in water.
What is the role of Ag+ ions in the formation of the octanuclear compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3AgNO3]2(NO3)8(PF6)4·15.5H2O?
data.answer: Ag+ ions interconnect two Pt3 triangles by binding to two pairs of N1,N1' nitrogen atoms of a bpz ligand and to two oxygen atoms of a chelating nitrate anion, forming a heterometallic square.

data.question: What are the association constants (Ka) for anion binding by the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ with PF6-, ClO4-, and BF4- in water?
True or False: The hexanuclear vases 3-6 display a similar anion binding pattern, incorporating a nitrate anion in the bottom M3 plane and a hexafluorophosphate anion on top.
What structural feature makes the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3]6+ different from other triangles with spatially fixed donor sites?
data.answer: Its flexibility, due to the low barrier of rotation about the central C2−C2' bond of the bpz ligand and because of monodentate binding of each pyrazine half to the heavy metal.

data.question: True or False: The compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3](NO3)2(ClO4)4·H2O (1a) incorporates both NO3- and ClO4- anions simultaneously in its cavity.
What is the empirical formula of the compound obtained by reacting enPdCl2 with AgNO3 and [enPd(bpz-N1,N1')]2+?
How does the compound [{enPt(bpz-N4,N4')}3AgNO3]3(NO3)12·AgNO3·22H2O (8a) resemble an organic carceplex?
data.answer: It is composed of two Pt3 cups connected via three AgNO3 units and an additional Ag+ located within the central cavity, resembling the structure of an organic carceplex.
